intro: Phelypaea mutelii subsp. pulchra, commonly known as the showy water fern, is a member of the Marsileaceae family. It is a floating aquatic plant characterized by its delicate, four-leaf clover-like structure. The plant thrives in freshwater environments, often found in ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are typically bright green and can exhibit a slight reddish tinge under certain conditions. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small organisms and contributing to water quality through oxygenation.
